ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8 hours
4 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Nice chance to learn the primary concepts of clinical trials
The final project is one of the most useful part of the course! Hope the content taught in the class can be more practical and more challenging.
This course is helpful understanding the big picture of clinical trials. The content of the course is comprehensive.
The group project was a wonderful experience to learn to get close to your friends.Peter is a great and responsible professor, love the class.

Lecture slides are good.I wish the course had been on track so we could cover more material and go over an actually study.Unlike other courses, the final project is initiated and discussed throughout the course so we could get feedback on what we are doing.
Good advanced course. Project was a lot of work but very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Commumicating between instructor and students were a part of class.It was so nice.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is really helpful in giving us advice.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is really helpful!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria did not teach too much in our class; but she was a wonderful helper and very responsible for our homework& assignments.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Prompt and very helpful in providing feedback for anything you ask.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  n/a
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Nice and kind instructor that I've ever met.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  He is a good instructor. He is very experienced. And his personality is quite influential.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Peter is a really good and nice instructor.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Very responsible and highly responsive professor. The professor has vast "real world" experience, definitely ask questions in class.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Well-rounded way of lecturing. Doesn't just read the slides. Actually discusses the material.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  He is very knowledgeable, resourceful, and willing to help.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: My interest in clinical trial has increased through this class andlearn very precious value of sharing knowledge and making the world different.
Yes!
Great. Strongly recommended since you can practice like you are in the real clinical trial field.

This course will help a lot to those people who are interested in clinical trial. This course does not focus on the biostat aspect of clinical trial, but the general concepts and the way to conduct a clinical trial. The project also give me a flavor of how to design a clinical trial with teammates.

Workload is light in the beginning, but get heavier towards the end of the semester when you have to do a group project.It's a very useful class if you are interested in clinical trials/study design/biostatistics.
Feels more like a seminar with a final project that you get guidance on throughout the second half ofthe semester.
good advanced topics course on clinical trials - learn a lot on how to design a clinical trial from the project.
